moves.name: Curse
moves.desc: If the user is not a Ghost type, lowers the user's Speed by 1 stage and raises the user's Attack and Defense by 1 stage. If the user is a Ghost type, the user loses 1/2 of its maximum HP, rounded down and even if it would cause fainting, in exchange for the target losing 1/4 of its maximum HP, rounded down, at the end of each turn while it is active. If the target uses Baton Pass, the replacement will continue to be affected. Fails if there is no target or if the target is already affected.

moves.name: Cut
moves.desc: No additional effect.

moves.name: Darkest Lariat
moves.desc: Ignores the target's stat stage changes, including evasiveness.

moves.name: Dark Pulse
moves.desc: Has a 20% chance to make the target flinch.

moves.name: Dark Void
moves.desc: Causes the target to fall asleep. This move cannot be used successfully unless the user's current form, while considering Transform, is Darkrai.

moves.name: Dazzling Gleam
moves.desc: No additional effect.

moves.name: Decorate
moves.desc: Raises the target's Attack and Special Attack by 2 stages.

moves.name: Defend Order
moves.desc: Raises the user's Defense and Special Defense by 1 stage.

moves.name: Defense Curl
moves.desc: Raises the user's Defense by 1 stage. As long as the user remains active, the power of the user's Ice Ball and Rollout will be doubled (this effect is not stackable).

moves.name: Defog
moves.desc: Lowers the target's evasiveness by 1 stage. If this move is successful and whether or not the target's evasiveness was affected, the effects of Reflect, Light Screen, Aurora Veil, Safeguard, Mist, Spikes, Toxic Spikes, Stealth Rock, and Sticky Web end for the target's side, and the effects of Spikes, Toxic Spikes, Stealth Rock, and Sticky Web end for the user's side. Ignores a target's substitute, although a substitute will still block the lowering of evasiveness. If there is a terrain active and this move is successful, the terrain will be cleared.

moves.name: Destiny Bond
moves.desc: Until the user's next move, if an opposing Pokemon's attack knocks the user out, that Pokemon faints as well, unless the attack was Doom Desire or Future Sight. Fails if the user used this move successfully as its last move, disregarding moves used through the Dancer Ability.

moves.name: Detect
moves.desc: The user is protected from most attacks made by other Pokemon during this turn. This move has a 1/X chance of being successful, where X starts at 1 and triples each time this move is successfully used. X resets to 1 if this move fails, if the user's last move used is not Baneful Bunker, Detect, Endure, King's Shield, Max Guard, Obstruct, Protect, Quick Guard, Silk Trap, Spiky Shield, or Wide Guard, or if it was one of those moves and the user's protection was broken. Fails if the user moves last this turn.

moves.name: Devastating Drake
moves.desc: Power is equal to the base move's Z-Power.

moves.name: Diamond Storm
moves.desc: Has a 50% chance to raise the user's Defense by 2 stages.

moves.name: Dig
moves.desc: This attack charges on the first turn and executes on the second. On the first turn, the user avoids all attacks other than Earthquake and Magnitude but takes double damage from them, and is also unaffected by weather. If the user is holding a Power Herb, the move completes in one turn.

moves.name: Disable
moves.desc: For 4 turns, the target's last move used becomes disabled. Fails if one of the target's moves is already disabled, if the target has not made a move, if the target no longer knows the move, or if the move was a Max or G-Max Move.

moves.name: Disarming Voice
moves.desc: This move does not check accuracy.

moves.name: Discharge
moves.desc: Has a 30% chance to paralyze the target.

moves.name: Dire Claw
moves.desc: Has a 50% chance to cause the target to either fall asleep, become poisoned, or become paralyzed.

moves.name: Dive
moves.desc: This attack charges on the first turn and executes on the second. On the first turn, the user avoids all attacks other than Surf and Whirlpool but takes double damage from them, and is also unaffected by weather. If the user is holding a Power Herb, the move completes in one turn.

moves.name: Dizzy Punch
moves.desc: Has a 20% chance to confuse the target.

moves.name: Doodle
moves.desc: The user and its ally's Abilities change to match the target's Ability. Does not change Ability if the user's or its ally's is As One, Battle Bond, Comatose, Commander, Disguise, Gulp Missile, Hadron Engine, Ice Face, Multitype, Orichalcum Pulse, Power Construct, Protosynthesis, Quark Drive, RKS System, Schooling, Shields Down, Stance Change, Zen Mode, Zero to Hero, or already matches the target. Fails if both the user and its ally's Ability already matches the target, or if the target's Ability is As One, Battle Bond, Comatose, Commander, Disguise, Flower Gift, Forecast, Gulp Missile, Hadron Engine, Hunger Switch, Ice Face, Illusion, Imposter, Multitype, Neutralizing Gas, Orichalcum Pulse, Power Construct, Power of Alchemy, Protosynthesis, Quark Drive, Receiver, RKS System, Schooling, Shields Down, Stance Change, Trace, Wonder Guard, Zen Mode, or Zero to Hero.

moves.name: Doom Desire
moves.desc: Deals damage two turns after this move is used. At the end of that turn, the damage is calculated at that time and dealt to the Pokemon at the position the target had when the move was used. If the user is no longer active at the time, damage is calculated based on the user's natural Special Attack stat, types, and level, with no boosts from its held item or Ability. Fails if this move or Future Sight is already in effect for the target's position.

moves.name: Double-Edge
moves.desc: If the target lost HP, the user takes recoil damage equal to 33% the HP lost by the target, rounded half up, but not less than 1 HP.

moves.name: Double Hit
moves.desc: Hits twice. If the first hit breaks the target's substitute, it will take damage for the second hit.

moves.name: Double Iron Bash
moves.desc: Hits twice. If the first hit breaks the target's substitute, it will take damage for the second hit. Has a 30% chance to make the target flinch.

moves.name: Double Kick
moves.desc: Hits twice. If the first hit breaks the target's substitute, it will take damage for the second hit.

moves.name: Double Shock
moves.desc: Fails unless the user is an Electric type. If this move is successful and the user is not Terastallized, the user's Electric type becomes typeless as long as it remains active.

moves.name: Double Slap
moves.desc: Hits two to five times. Has a 35% chance to hit two or three times and a 15% chance to hit four or five times. If one of the hits breaks the target's substitute, it will take damage for the remaining hits. If the user has the Skill Link Ability, this move will always hit five times.

moves.name: Double Team
moves.desc: Raises the user's evasiveness by 1 stage.

moves.name: Draco Meteor
moves.desc: Lowers the user's Special Attack by 2 stages.

moves.name: Dragon Ascent
moves.desc: Lowers the user's Defense and Special Defense by 1 stage.

moves.name: Dragon Breath
moves.desc: Has a 30% chance to paralyze the target.

moves.name: Dragon Claw
moves.desc: No additional effect.

moves.name: Dragon Dance
moves.desc: Raises the user's Attack and Speed by 1 stage.

moves.name: Dragon Darts
moves.desc: Hits twice. If the first hit breaks the target's substitute, it will take damage for the second hit. In Double Battles, this move attempts to hit the targeted Pokemon and its ally once each. If hitting one of these Pokemon would be prevented by immunity, protection, semi-invulnerability, an Ability, or accuracy, it attempts to hit the other Pokemon twice instead. If this move is redirected, it hits that target twice.

moves.name: Dragon Energy
moves.desc: Power is equal to (user's current HP * 150 / user's maximum HP), rounded down, but not less than 1.

moves.name: Dragon Hammer
moves.desc: No additional effect.

moves.name: Dragon Pulse
moves.desc: No additional effect.

moves.name: Dragon Rage
moves.desc: Deals 40 HP of damage to the target.

moves.name: Dragon Rush
moves.desc: Has a 20% chance to make the target flinch. Damage doubles and no accuracy check is done if the target has used Minimize while active.

moves.name: Dragon Tail
moves.desc: If both the user and the target have not fainted, the target is forced to switch out and be replaced with a random unfainted ally. This effect fails if the target used Ingrain previously, has the Suction Cups Ability, or this move hit a substitute.

moves.name: Draining Kiss
moves.desc: The user recovers 3/4 the HP lost by the target, rounded half up. If Big Root is held by the user, the HP recovered is 1.3x normal, rounded half down.

moves.name: Drain Punch
moves.desc: The user recovers 1/2 the HP lost by the target, rounded half up. If Big Root is held by the user, the HP recovered is 1.3x normal, rounded half down.

moves.name: Dream Eater
moves.desc: The target is unaffected by this move unless it is asleep. The user recovers 1/2 the HP lost by the target, rounded half up. If Big Root is held by the user, the HP recovered is 1.3x normal, rounded half down.

moves.name: Drill Peck
moves.desc: No additional effect.

moves.name: Drill Run
moves.desc: Has a higher chance for a critical hit.

moves.name: Drum Beating
moves.desc: Has a 100% chance to lower the target's Speed by 1 stage.

moves.name: Dual Chop
moves.desc: Hits twice. If the first hit breaks the target's substitute, it will take damage for the second hit.

moves.name: Dual Wingbeat
moves.desc: Hits twice. If the first hit breaks the target's substitute, it will take damage for the second hit.

moves.name: Dynamax Cannon
moves.desc: No additional effect.

moves.name: Dynamic Punch
moves.desc: Has a 100% chance to confuse the target.

moves.name: Earth Power
moves.desc: Has a 10% chance to lower the target's Special Defense by 1 stage.

moves.name: Earthquake
moves.desc: Damage doubles if the target is using Dig.

moves.name: Echoed Voice
moves.desc: For every consecutive turn that this move is used by at least one Pokemon, this move's power is multiplied by the number of turns to pass, but not more than 5.

moves.name: Eerie Impulse
moves.desc: Lowers the target's Special Attack by 2 stages.

moves.name: Eerie Spell
moves.desc: If this move is successful and the user has not fainted, the target loses 3 PP from its last move.

moves.name: Egg Bomb
moves.desc: No additional effect.

moves.name: Electric Terrain
moves.desc: For 5 turns, the terrain becomes Electric Terrain. During the effect, the power of Electric-type attacks made by grounded Pokemon is multiplied by 1.3 and grounded Pokemon cannot fall asleep; Pokemon already asleep do not wake up. Grounded Pokemon cannot become affected by Yawn or fall asleep from its effect. Camouflage transforms the user into an Electric type, Nature Power becomes Thunderbolt, and Secret Power has a 30% chance to cause paralysis. Fails if the current terrain is Electric Terrain.

moves.name: Electrify
moves.desc: Causes the target's move to become Electric type this turn. Among effects that can change a move's type, this effect happens last. Fails if the target already moved this turn.

moves.name: Electro Ball
moves.desc: The power of this move depends on (user's current Speed / target's current Speed), rounded down. Power is equal to 150 if the result is 4 or more, 120 if 3, 80 if 2, 60 if 1, 40 if less than 1. If the target's current Speed is 0, this move's power is 40.

moves.name: Electro Drift
moves.desc: Damage is multiplied by 1.3333 if this move is super effective against the target.

moves.name: Electroweb
moves.desc: Has a 100% chance to lower the target's Speed by 1 stage.

moves.name: Embargo
moves.desc: For 5 turns, the target's held item has no effect. An item's effect of causing forme changes is unaffected, but any other effects from such items are negated. During the effect, Fling and Natural Gift are prevented from being used by the target. Items thrown at the target with Fling will still activate for it. If the target uses Baton Pass, the replacement will remain unable to use items.

moves.name: Ember
moves.desc: Has a 10% chance to burn the target.

moves.name: Encore
moves.desc: For its next 3 turns, the target is forced to repeat its last move used. If the affected move runs out of PP, the effect ends. Fails if the target is already under this effect, if it has not made a move, if the move has 0 PP, or if the move is Assist, Blazing Torque, Combat Torque, Copycat, Dynamax Cannon, Encore, Magical Torque, Me First, Metronome, Mimic, Mirror Move, Nature Power, Noxious Torque, Sketch, Sleep Talk, Struggle, Transform, or Wicked Torque.

moves.name: Endeavor
moves.desc: Deals damage to the target equal to (target's current HP - user's current HP). The target is unaffected if its current HP is less than or equal to the user's current HP.

moves.name: Endure
moves.desc: The user will survive attacks made by other Pokemon during this turn with at least 1 HP. This move has a 1/X chance of being successful, where X starts at 1 and triples each time this move is successfully used. X resets to 1 if this move fails, if the user's last move used is not Baneful Bunker, Detect, Endure, King's Shield, Max Guard, Obstruct, Protect, Quick Guard, Silk Trap, Spiky Shield, or Wide Guard, or if it was one of those moves and the user's protection was broken. Fails if the user moves last this turn.

moves.name: Energy Ball
moves.desc: Has a 10% chance to lower the target's Special Defense by 1 stage.

moves.name: Entrainment
moves.desc: Causes the target's Ability to become the same as the user's. Fails if the target's Ability is As One, Battle Bond, Comatose, Commander, Disguise, Gulp Missile, Hadron Engine, Ice Face, Multitype, Orichalcum Pulse, Power Construct, Protosynthesis, Quark Drive, RKS System, Schooling, Shields Down, Stance Change, Truant, Zen Mode, Zero to Hero, or the same Ability as the user, or if the user's Ability is As One, Battle Bond, Comatose, Commander, Disguise, Flower Gift, Forecast, Gulp Missile, Hadron Engine, Hunger Switch, Ice Face, Illusion, Imposter, Multitype, Neutralizing Gas, Orichalcum Pulse, Power Construct, Power of Alchemy, Protosynthesis, Quark Drive, Receiver, RKS System, Schooling, Shields Down, Stance Change, Trace, Zen Mode, or Zero to Hero.

moves.name: Eruption
moves.desc: Power is equal to (user's current HP * 150 / user's maximum HP), rounded down, but not less than 1.

moves.name: Esper Wing
moves.desc: Has a 100% chance to raise the user's Speed by 1 stage and a higher chance for a critical hit.

moves.name: Eternabeam
moves.desc: If this move is successful, the user must recharge on the following turn and cannot select a move.

moves.name: Expanding Force
moves.desc: If the current terrain is Psychic Terrain and the user is grounded, this move hits all opposing Pokemon and has its power multiplied by 1.5.

moves.name: Explosion
moves.desc: The user faints after using this move, even if this move fails for having no target. This move is prevented from executing if any active Pokemon has the Damp Ability.

moves.name: Extrasensory
moves.desc: Has a 10% chance to make the target flinch.

moves.name: Extreme Evoboost
moves.desc: Raises the user's Attack, Defense, Special Attack, Special Defense, and Speed by 2 stages.

moves.name: Extreme Speed
moves.desc: No additional effect.

moves.name: Facade
moves.desc: Power doubles if the user is burned, paralyzed, or poisoned. The physical damage halving effect from the user's burn is ignored.

moves.name: Fairy Lock
moves.desc: Prevents all active Pokemon from switching next turn. A Pokemon can still switch out if it is holding Shed Shell or uses Baton Pass, Flip Turn, Parting Shot, Teleport, U-turn, or Volt Switch. Fails if the effect is already active.

moves.name: Fairy Wind
moves.desc: No additional effect.

moves.name: Fake Out
moves.desc: Has a 100% chance to make the target flinch. Fails unless it is the user's first turn on the field.

moves.name: Fake Tears
moves.desc: Lowers the target's Special Defense by 2 stages.

moves.name: False Surrender
moves.desc: This move does not check accuracy.

moves.name: False Swipe
moves.desc: Leaves the target with at least 1 HP.

moves.name: Feather Dance
moves.desc: Lowers the target's Attack by 2 stages.

moves.name: Feint
moves.desc: If this move is successful, it breaks through the target's Baneful Bunker, Detect, King's Shield, Protect, or Spiky Shield for this turn, allowing other Pokemon to attack the target normally. If the target's side is protected by Crafty Shield, Mat Block, Quick Guard, or Wide Guard, that protection is also broken for this turn and other Pokemon may attack the target's side normally.

moves.name: Feint Attack
moves.desc: This move does not check accuracy.

moves.name: Fell Stinger
moves.desc: Raises the user's Attack by 3 stages if this move knocks out the target.

moves.name: Fiery Dance
moves.desc: Has a 50% chance to raise the user's Special Attack by 1 stage.

moves.name: Fiery Wrath
moves.desc: Has a 20% chance to make the target flinch.

moves.name: Fillet Away
moves.desc: Raises the user's Attack, Special Attack, and Speed by 2 stages in exchange for the user losing 1/2 of its maximum HP, rounded down. Fails if the user would faint or if its Attack, Special Attack, and Speed stat stages would not change.

moves.name: Final Gambit
moves.desc: Deals damage to the target equal to the user's current HP. If this move is successful, the user faints.

moves.name: Fire Blast
moves.desc: Has a 10% chance to burn the target.

moves.name: Fire Fang
moves.desc: Has a 10% chance to burn the target and a 10% chance to make it flinch.

moves.name: Fire Lash
moves.desc: Has a 100% chance to lower the target's Defense by 1 stage.

moves.name: Fire Pledge
moves.desc: If one of the user's allies chose to use Grass Pledge or Water Pledge this turn and has not moved yet, it takes its turn immediately after the user and the user's move does nothing. If combined with Grass Pledge, the ally uses Fire Pledge with 150 power and a sea of fire appears on the target's side for 4 turns, which causes damage to non-Fire types equal to 1/8 of their maximum HP, rounded down, at the end of each turn during effect, including the last turn. If combined with Water Pledge, the ally uses Water Pledge with 150 power and a rainbow appears on the user's side for 4 turns, which doubles secondary effect chances and stacks with the Serene Grace Ability, except effects that cause flinching can only have their chance doubled once. When used as a combined move, this move gains STAB no matter what the user's type is. This move does not consume the user's Fire Gem.

moves.name: Fire Punch
moves.desc: Has a 10% chance to burn the target.

moves.name: Fire Spin
moves.desc: Prevents the target from switching for four or five turns (seven turns if the user is holding Grip Claw). Causes damage to the target equal to 1/8 of its maximum HP (1/6 if the user is holding Binding Band), rounded down, at the end of each turn during effect. The target can still switch out if it is holding Shed Shell or uses Baton Pass, Flip Turn, Parting Shot, Shed Tail, Teleport, U-turn, or Volt Switch. The effect ends if either the user or the target leaves the field, or if the target uses Mortal Spin, Rapid Spin, or Substitute successfully. This effect is not stackable or reset by using this or another binding move.

moves.name: First Impression
moves.desc: Fails unless it is the user's first turn on the field.

moves.name: Fishious Rend
moves.desc: Power doubles if the user moves before the target.

moves.name: Fissure
moves.desc: Deals damage to the target equal to the target's maximum HP. Ignores accuracy and evasiveness modifiers. This attack's accuracy is equal to (user's level - target's level + 30)%, and fails if the target is at a higher level. Pokemon with the Sturdy Ability are immune.

moves.name: Flail
moves.desc: The power of this move is 20 if X is 33 to 48, 40 if X is 17 to 32, 80 if X is 10 to 16, 100 if X is 5 to 9, 150 if X is 2 to 4, and 200 if X is 0 or 1, where X is equal to (user's current HP * 48 / user's maximum HP), rounded down.

moves.name: Flame Burst
moves.desc: If this move is successful, the target's ally loses 1/16 of its maximum HP, rounded down, unless it has the Magic Guard Ability.

moves.name: Flame Charge
moves.desc: Has a 100% chance to raise the user's Speed by 1 stage.

moves.name: Flame Wheel
moves.desc: Has a 10% chance to burn the target.

moves.name: Flamethrower
moves.desc: Has a 10% chance to burn the target.

moves.name: Flare Blitz
moves.desc: Has a 10% chance to burn the target. If the target lost HP, the user takes recoil damage equal to 33% the HP lost by the target, rounded half up, but not less than 1 HP.

moves.name: Flash
moves.desc: Lowers the target's accuracy by 1 stage.

moves.name: Flash Cannon
moves.desc: Has a 10% chance to lower the target's Special Defense by 1 stage.

moves.name: Flatter
moves.desc: Raises the target's Special Attack by 1 stage and confuses it.

moves.name: Fleur Cannon
moves.desc: Lowers the user's Special Attack by 2 stages.

moves.name: Fling
moves.desc: The power of this move is based on the user's held item. The held item is lost and it activates for the target if applicable. If there is no target or the target avoids this move by protecting itself, the user's held item is still lost. The user can regain a thrown item with Recycle or the Harvest Ability. Fails if the user has no held item, if the held item cannot be thrown, if the user is under the effect of Embargo or Magic Room, or if the user has the Klutz Ability.

moves.name: Flip Turn
moves.desc: If this move is successful and the user has not fainted, the user switches out even if it is trapped and is replaced immediately by a selected party member. The user does not switch out if there are no unfainted party members, or if the target switched out using an Eject Button or through the effect of the Emergency Exit or Wimp Out Abilities.

moves.name: Floaty Fall
moves.desc: Has a 30% chance to make the target flinch.

moves.name: Floral Healing
moves.desc: The target restores 1/2 of its maximum HP, rounded half up. If the terrain is Grassy Terrain, the target instead restores 2/3 of its maximum HP, rounded half down.

moves.name: Flower Shield
moves.desc: Raises the Defense of all active Grass-type Pokemon by 1 stage. Fails if there are no active Grass-type Pokemon.

moves.name: Flower Trick
moves.desc: This move is always a critical hit unless the target is under the effect of Lucky Chant or has the Battle Armor or Shell Armor Abilities. This move does not check accuracy.

moves.name: Fly
moves.desc: This attack charges on the first turn and executes on the second. On the first turn, the user avoids all attacks other than Gust, Hurricane, Sky Uppercut, Smack Down, Thousand Arrows, Thunder, and Twister, and Gust and Twister have doubled power when used against it. If the user is holding a Power Herb, the move completes in one turn.

moves.name: Flying Press
moves.desc: This move combines Flying in its type effectiveness against the target. Damage doubles and no accuracy check is done if the target has used Minimize while active.

moves.name: Focus Blast
moves.desc: Has a 10% chance to lower the target's Special Defense by 1 stage.

moves.name: Focus Energy
moves.desc: Raises the user's chance for a critical hit by 2 stages. Fails if the user already has the effect. Baton Pass can be used to transfer this effect to an ally.

moves.name: Focus Punch
moves.desc: The user loses its focus and does nothing if it is hit by a damaging attack this turn before it can execute the move.

moves.name: Follow Me
moves.desc: Until the end of the turn, all single-target attacks from the opposing side are redirected to the user. Such attacks are redirected to the user before they can be reflected by Magic Coat or the Magic Bounce Ability, or drawn in by the Lightning Rod or Storm Drain Abilities. Fails if it is not a Double Battle or Battle Royal. This effect is ignored while the user is under the effect of Sky Drop.

moves.name: Force Palm
moves.desc: Has a 30% chance to paralyze the target.

moves.name: Foresight
moves.desc: As long as the target remains active, its evasiveness stat stage is ignored during accuracy checks against it if it is greater than 0, and Normal- and Fighting-type attacks can hit the target if it is a Ghost type. Fails if the target is already affected, or affected by Miracle Eye or Odor Sleuth.

moves.name: Forest's Curse
moves.desc: Causes the Grass type to be added to the target, effectively making it have two or three types. Fails if the target is already a Grass type. If Trick-or-Treat adds a type to the target, it replaces the type added by this move and vice versa.

moves.name: Foul Play
moves.desc: Damage is calculated using the target's Attack stat, including stat stage changes. The user's Ability, item, and burn are used as normal.

moves.name: Freeze-Dry
moves.desc: Has a 10% chance to freeze the target. This move's type effectiveness against Water is changed to be super effective no matter what this move's type is.

moves.name: Freeze Shock
moves.desc: Has a 30% chance to paralyze the target. This attack charges on the first turn and executes on the second. If the user is holding a Power Herb, the move completes in one turn.

moves.name: Freezing Glare
moves.desc: Has a 10% chance to freeze the target.

moves.name: Freezy Frost
moves.desc: Resets the stat stages of all active Pokemon to 0.

moves.name: Frenzy Plant
moves.desc: If this move is successful, the user must recharge on the following turn and cannot select a move.

moves.name: Frost Breath
moves.desc: This move is always a critical hit unless the target is under the effect of Lucky Chant or has the Battle Armor or Shell Armor Abilities.

moves.name: Frustration
moves.desc: Power is equal to the greater of ((255 - user's Happiness) * 2/5), rounded down, or 1.

moves.name: Fury Attack
moves.desc: Hits two to five times. Has a 35% chance to hit two or three times and a 15% chance to hit four or five times. If one of the hits breaks the target's substitute, it will take damage for the remaining hits. If the user has the Skill Link Ability, this move will always hit five times.

moves.name: Fury Cutter
moves.desc: Power doubles with each successful hit, up to a maximum of 160 power. The power is reset if this move misses or another move is used.

moves.name: Fury Swipes
moves.desc: Hits two to five times. Has a 35% chance to hit two or three times and a 15% chance to hit four or five times. If one of the hits breaks the target's substitute, it will take damage for the remaining hits. If the user has the Skill Link Ability, this move will always hit five times.

moves.name: Fusion Bolt
moves.desc: Power doubles if the last move used by any Pokemon this turn was Fusion Flare.

moves.name: Fusion Flare
moves.desc: Power doubles if the last move used by any Pokemon this turn was Fusion Bolt.

moves.name: Future Sight
moves.desc: Deals damage two turns after this move is used. At the end of that turn, the damage is calculated at that time and dealt to the Pokemon at the position the target had when the move was used. If the user is no longer active at the time, damage is calculated based on the user's natural Special Attack stat, types, and level, with no boosts from its held item or Ability. Fails if this move or Doom Desire is already in effect for the target's position.

moves.name: Gastro Acid
moves.desc: Causes the target's Ability to be rendered ineffective as long as it remains active. If the target uses Baton Pass, the replacement will remain under this effect. If the target's Ability is As One, Battle Bond, Comatose, Commander, Disguise, Gulp Missile, Hadron Engine, Ice Face, Multitype, Orichalcum Pulse, Power Construct, Protosynthesis, Quark Drive, RKS System, Schooling, Shields Down, Stance Change, Zen Mode, or Zero to Hero, this move fails, and receiving the effect through Baton Pass ends the effect immediately.

moves.name: Gear Grind
moves.desc: Hits twice. If the first hit breaks the target's substitute, it will take damage for the second hit.

moves.name: Gear Up
moves.desc: Raises the Attack and Special Attack of Pokemon on the user's side with the Plus or Minus Abilities by 1 stage.

moves.name: Genesis Supernova

moves.name: Seismic Toss
moves.desc: Deals damage to the target equal to the user's level.

moves.name: Self-Destruct
moves.desc: The user faints after using this move, even if this move fails for having no target. This move is prevented from executing if any active Pokemon has the Damp Ability.

moves.name: Shadow Ball
moves.desc: Has a 20% chance to lower the target's Special Defense by 1 stage.

moves.name: Shadow Bone
moves.desc: Has a 20% chance to lower the target's Defense by 1 stage.

moves.name: Shadow Claw
moves.desc: Has a higher chance for a critical hit.

moves.name: Shadow Force
moves.desc: If this move is successful, it breaks through the target's Baneful Bunker, Detect, King's Shield, Protect, or Spiky Shield for this turn, allowing other Pokemon to attack the target normally. If the target's side is protected by Crafty Shield, Mat Block, Quick Guard, or Wide Guard, that protection is also broken for this turn and other Pokemon may attack the target's side normally. This attack charges on the first turn and executes on the second. On the first turn, the user avoids all attacks. If the user is holding a Power Herb, the move completes in one turn.

moves.name: Shadow Punch
moves.desc: This move does not check accuracy.

moves.name: Shadow Sneak
moves.desc: No additional effect.

moves.name: Shadow Strike
moves.desc: Has a 50% chance to lower the target's Defense by 1 stage.

moves.name: Sharpen
moves.desc: Raises the user's Attack by 1 stage.

moves.name: Shattered Psyche
moves.desc: Power is equal to the base move's Z-Power.

moves.name: Shed Tail
moves.desc: The user takes 1/2 of its maximum HP, rounded up, and creates a substitute that has 1/4 of the user's maximum HP, rounded down. The user is replaced with another Pokemon in its party and the selected Pokemon has the substitute transferred to it. Fails if the user would faint, or if there are no unfainted party members.

moves.name: Sheer Cold
moves.desc: Deals damage to the target equal to the target's maximum HP. Ignores accuracy and evasiveness modifiers. This attack's accuracy is equal to (user's level - target's level + X)%, where X is 30 if the user is an Ice type and 20 otherwise, and fails if the target is at a higher level. Ice-type Pokemon and Pokemon with the Sturdy Ability are immune.

moves.name: Shell Side Arm
moves.desc: Has a 20% chance to poison the target. This move becomes a physical attack that makes contact if the value of ((((2 * the user's level / 5 + 2) * 90 * X) / Y) / 50), where X is the user's Attack stat and Y is the target's Defense stat, is greater than the same value where X is the user's Special Attack stat and Y is the target's Special Defense stat. No stat modifiers other than stat stage changes are considered for this purpose. If the two values are equal, this move chooses a damage category at random.

moves.name: Shell Smash
moves.desc: Lowers the user's Defense and Special Defense by 1 stage. Raises the user's Attack, Special Attack, and Speed by 2 stages.

moves.name: Shell Trap
moves.desc: Fails unless the user is hit by a physical attack from an opponent this turn before it can execute the move. If the user was hit and has not fainted, it attacks immediately after being hit, and the effect ends. If the opponent's physical attack had a secondary effect removed by the Sheer Force Ability, it does not count for the purposes of this effect.

moves.name: Shelter
moves.desc: Raises the user's Defense by 2 stages.

moves.name: Shift Gear
moves.desc: Raises the user's Speed by 2 stages and its Attack by 1 stage.

moves.name: Shock Wave
moves.desc: This move does not check accuracy.

moves.name: Shore Up
moves.desc: The user restores 1/2 of its maximum HP, rounded half down. If the weather is Sandstorm, the user instead restores 2/3 of its maximum HP, rounded half down.

moves.name: Signal Beam
moves.desc: Has a 10% chance to confuse the target.

moves.name: Silk Trap
moves.desc: The user is protected from most attacks made by other Pokemon during this turn, and Pokemon trying to make contact with the user have their Speed lowered by 1 stage. Non-damaging moves go through this protection. This move has a 1/X chance of being successful, where X starts at 1 and triples each time this move is successfully used. X resets to 1 if this move fails, if the user's last move used is not Baneful Bunker, Detect, Endure, King's Shield, Max Guard, Obstruct, Protect, Quick Guard, Silk Trap, Spiky Shield, or Wide Guard, or if it was one of those moves and the user's protection was broken. Fails if the user moves last this turn.

moves.name: Silver Wind
moves.desc: Has a 10% chance to raise the user's Attack, Defense, Special Attack, Special Defense, and Speed by 1 stage.

moves.name: Simple Beam
moves.desc: Causes the target's Ability to become Simple. Fails if the target's Ability is As One, Battle Bond, Comatose, Commander, Disguise, Gulp Missile, Hadron Engine, Ice Face, Multitype, Orichalcum Pulse, Power Construct, Protosynthesis, Quark Drive, RKS System, Schooling, Shields Down, Simple, Stance Change, Truant, Zen Mode, or Zero to Hero.

moves.name: Sing
moves.desc: Causes the target to fall asleep.

moves.name: Sinister Arrow Raid
moves.desc: No additional effect.

moves.name: Sizzly Slide
moves.desc: Has a 100% chance to burn the foe.

moves.name: Sketch
moves.desc: This move is permanently replaced by the last move used by the target. The copied move has the maximum PP for that move. Fails if the target has not made a move, if the user has Transformed, or if the move is Chatter, Sketch, Struggle, or any move the user knows.

moves.name: Skill Swap
moves.desc: The user swaps its Ability with the target's Ability. Fails if either the user or the target's Ability is As One, Battle Bond, Comatose, Commander, Disguise, Gulp Missile, Hadron Engine, Hunger Switch, Ice Face, Illusion, Multitype, Neutralizing Gas, Orichalcum Pulse, Power Construct, Protosynthesis, Quark Drive, RKS System, Schooling, Shields Down, Stance Change, Wonder Guard, Zen Mode, or Zero to Hero.

moves.name: Skitter Smack
moves.desc: Has a 100% chance to lower the target's Special Attack by 1 stage.

moves.name: Skull Bash
moves.desc: This attack charges on the first turn and executes on the second. Raises the user's Defense by 1 stage on the first turn. If the user is holding a Power Herb, the move completes in one turn.

moves.name: Sky Attack
moves.desc: Has a 30% chance to make the target flinch and a higher chance for a critical hit. This attack charges on the first turn and executes on the second. If the user is holding a Power Herb, the move completes in one turn.

moves.name: Sky Drop
moves.desc: This attack takes the target into the air with the user on the first turn and executes on the second. Pokemon weighing 200 kg or more cannot be lifted. On the first turn, the user and the target avoid all attacks other than Gust, Hurricane, Sky Uppercut, Smack Down, Thousand Arrows, Thunder, and Twister. The user and the target cannot make a move between turns, but the target can select a move to use. This move cannot damage Flying-type Pokemon. Fails on the first turn if the target is an ally, if the target has a substitute, or if the target is using Bounce, Dig, Dive, Fly, Phantom Force, Shadow Force, or Sky Drop.

moves.name: Sky Uppercut
moves.desc: This move can hit a target using Bounce, Fly, or Sky Drop, or is under the effect of Sky Drop.

moves.name: Slack Off
moves.desc: The user restores 1/2 of its maximum HP, rounded half up.

moves.name: Slam
moves.desc: No additional effect.

moves.name: Slash
moves.desc: Has a higher chance for a critical hit.

moves.name: Sleep Powder
moves.desc: Causes the target to fall asleep.

moves.name: Sleep Talk
moves.desc: One of the user's known moves, besides this move, is selected for use at random. Fails if the user is not asleep. The selected move does not have PP deducted from it, and can currently have 0 PP. This move cannot select Assist, Beak Blast, Belch, Bide, Blazing Torque, Celebrate, Chatter, Combat Torque, Copycat, Dynamax Cannon, Focus Punch, Hold Hands, Magical Torque, Me First, Metronome, Mimic, Mirror Move, Nature Power, Noxious Torque, Shell Trap, Sketch, Sleep Talk, Struggle, Uproar, Wicked Torque, or any two-turn move.

moves.name: Sludge
moves.desc: Has a 30% chance to poison the target.

moves.name: Sludge Bomb
moves.desc: Has a 30% chance to poison the target.

moves.name: Sludge Wave
moves.desc: Has a 10% chance to poison the target.

moves.name: Smack Down
moves.desc: This move can hit a target using Bounce, Fly, or Sky Drop, or is under the effect of Sky Drop. If this move hits a target under the effect of Bounce, Fly, Magnet Rise, or Telekinesis, the effect ends. If the target is a Flying type that has not used Roost this turn or a Pokemon with the Levitate Ability, it loses its immunity to Ground-type attacks and the Arena Trap Ability as long as it remains active. During the effect, Magnet Rise fails for the target and Telekinesis fails against the target.

moves.name: Smart Strike
moves.desc: This move does not check accuracy.

moves.name: Smelling Salts
moves.desc: Power doubles if the target is paralyzed. If the user has not fainted, the target is cured of paralysis.

moves.name: Smog
moves.desc: Has a 40% chance to poison the target.

moves.name: Smokescreen
moves.desc: Lowers the target's accuracy by 1 stage.

moves.name: Snap Trap
moves.desc: Prevents the target from switching for four or five turns (seven turns if the user is holding Grip Claw). Causes damage to the target equal to 1/8 of its maximum HP (1/6 if the user is holding Binding Band), rounded down, at the end of each turn during effect. The target can still switch out if it is holding Shed Shell or uses Baton Pass, Flip Turn, Parting Shot, Shed Tail, Teleport, U-turn, or Volt Switch. The effect ends if either the user or the target leaves the field, or if the target uses Mortal Spin, Rapid Spin, or Substitute successfully. This effect is not stackable or reset by using this or another binding move.

moves.name: Snarl
moves.desc: Has a 100% chance to lower the target's Special Attack by 1 stage.

moves.name: Snatch
moves.desc: If another Pokemon uses certain non-damaging moves this turn, the user steals that move to use itself. If multiple Pokemon use one of those moves this turn, the applicable moves are all stolen by the first Pokemon in turn order that used this move this turn. This effect is ignored while the user is under the effect of Sky Drop.

moves.name: Snipe Shot
moves.desc: Has a higher chance for a critical hit. This move cannot be redirected to a different target by any effect.

moves.name: Snore
moves.desc: Has a 30% chance to make the target flinch. Fails if the user is not asleep.

moves.name: Snowscape
moves.desc: For 5 turns, the weather becomes Snow. During the effect, the Defense of Ice-type Pokemon is multiplied by 1.5 when taking damage from a physical attack. Lasts for 8 turns if the user is holding Icy Rock. Fails if the current weather is Snow.

moves.name: Soak
moves.desc: Causes the target to become a Water type. Fails if the target is an Arceus or a Silvally, if the target is already purely Water type, or if the target is Terastallized.

moves.name: Soft-Boiled
moves.desc: The user restores 1/2 of its maximum HP, rounded half up.

moves.name: Solar Beam
moves.desc: This attack charges on the first turn and executes on the second. Power is halved if the weather is Primordial Sea, Rain Dance, Sandstorm, or Snow and the user is not holding Utility Umbrella. If the user is holding a Power Herb or the weather is Desolate Land or Sunny Day, the move completes in one turn. If the user is holding Utility Umbrella and the weather is Desolate Land or Sunny Day, the move still requires a turn to charge.

moves.name: Solar Blade
moves.desc: This attack charges on the first turn and executes on the second. Power is halved if the weather is Hail, Primordial Sea, Rain Dance, or Sandstorm and the user is not holding Utility Umbrella. If the user is holding a Power Herb or the weather is Desolate Land or Sunny Day, the move completes in one turn. If the user is holding Utility Umbrella and the weather is Desolate Land or Sunny Day, the move still requires a turn to charge.

moves.name: Sonic Boom
moves.desc: Deals 20 HP of damage to the target.

moves.name: Soul-Stealing 7-Star Strike
moves.desc: No additional effect.

moves.name: Spacial Rend
moves.desc: Has a higher chance for a critical hit.

moves.name: Spark
moves.desc: Has a 30% chance to paralyze the target.

moves.name: Sparkling Aria
moves.desc: If the user has not fainted, the target is cured of its burn.

moves.name: Sparkly Swirl
moves.desc: Every Pokemon in the user's party is cured of its non-volatile status condition.

moves.name: Spectral Thief
moves.desc: The target's stat stages greater than 0 are stolen from it and applied to the user before dealing damage.

moves.name: Speed Swap
moves.desc: The user swaps its Speed stat with the target. Stat stage changes are unaffected.

moves.name: Spicy Extract
moves.desc: Raises the target's Attack by 2 stages and lowers its Defense by 2 stages.

moves.name: Spider Web
moves.desc: Prevents the target from switching out. The target can still switch out if it is holding Shed Shell or uses Baton Pass, Flip Turn, Parting Shot, Teleport, U-turn, or Volt Switch. If the target leaves the field using Baton Pass, the replacement will remain trapped. The effect ends if the user leaves the field.

moves.name: Spike Cannon
moves.desc: Hits two to five times. Has a 35% chance to hit two or three times and a 15% chance to hit four or five times. If one of the hits breaks the target's substitute, it will take damage for the remaining hits. If the user has the Skill Link Ability, this move will always hit five times.

moves.name: Spikes
moves.desc: Sets up a hazard on the opposing side of the field, damaging each opposing Pokemon that switches in, unless it is a Flying-type Pokemon or has the Levitate Ability. Can be used up to three times before failing. Opponents lose 1/8 of their maximum HP with one layer, 1/6 of their maximum HP with two layers, and 1/4 of their maximum HP with three layers, all rounded down. Can be removed from the opposing side if any opposing Pokemon uses Mortal Spin, Rapid Spin, or Defog successfully, or is hit by Defog.

moves.name: Spiky Shield
moves.desc: The user is protected from most attacks made by other Pokemon during this turn, and Pokemon making contact with the user lose 1/8 of their maximum HP, rounded down. This move has a 1/X chance of being successful, where X starts at 1 and triples each time this move is successfully used. X resets to 1 if this move fails, if the user's last move used is not Baneful Bunker, Detect, Endure, King's Shield, Max Guard, Obstruct, Protect, Quick Guard, Silk Trap, Spiky Shield, or Wide Guard, or if it was one of those moves and the user's protection was broken. Fails if the user moves last this turn.

moves.name: Spin Out
moves.desc: Lowers the user's Speed by 2 stages.

moves.name: Spirit Break
moves.desc: Has a 100% chance to lower the target's Special Attack by 1 stage.

moves.name: Spirit Shackle
moves.desc: Prevents the target from switching out. The target can still switch out if it is holding Shed Shell or uses Baton Pass, Flip Turn, Parting Shot, Teleport, U-turn, or Volt Switch. If the target leaves the field using Baton Pass, the replacement will remain trapped. The effect ends if the user leaves the field.

moves.name: Spit Up
moves.desc: Power is equal to 100 times the user's Stockpile count. Fails if the user's Stockpile count is 0. Whether or not this move is successful, the user's Defense and Special Defense decrease by as many stages as Stockpile had increased them, and the user's Stockpile count resets to 0.

moves.name: Spite
moves.desc: Causes the target's last move used to lose 4 PP. Fails if the target has not made a move, if the move has 0 PP, or if it no longer knows the move.

moves.name: Splash
moves.desc: No competitive use.

moves.name: Splintered Stormshards
moves.desc: Ends the effects of Electric Terrain, Grassy Terrain, Misty Terrain, and Psychic Terrain.

moves.name: Splishy Splash
moves.desc: Has a 30% chance to paralyze the target.

moves.name: Spore
moves.desc: Causes the target to fall asleep.

moves.name: Spotlight
moves.desc: Until the end of the turn, all single-target attacks from opponents of the target are redirected to the target. Such attacks are redirected to the target before they can be reflected by Magic Coat or the Magic Bounce Ability, or drawn in by the Lightning Rod or Storm Drain Abilities. Fails if it is not a Double Battle or Battle Royal.

moves.name: Springtide Storm
moves.desc: Has a 30% chance to lower the target's Attack by 1 stage.

moves.name: Stealth Rock
moves.desc: Sets up a hazard on the opposing side of the field, damaging each opposing Pokemon that switches in. Fails if the effect is already active on the opposing side. Foes lose 1/32, 1/16, 1/8, 1/4, or 1/2 of their maximum HP, rounded down, based on their weakness to the Rock type; 0.25x, 0.5x, neutral, 2x, or 4x, respectively. Can be removed from the opposing side if any opposing Pokemon uses Mortal Spin, Rapid Spin, or Defog successfully, or is hit by Defog.

moves.name: Steam Eruption
moves.desc: Has a 30% chance to burn the target. The target thaws out if it is frozen.

moves.name: Steamroller
moves.desc: Has a 30% chance to make the target flinch. Damage doubles and no accuracy check is done if the target has used Minimize while active.

moves.name: Steel Beam
moves.desc: Whether or not this move is successful and even if it would cause fainting, the user loses 1/2 of its maximum HP, rounded up, unless the user has the Magic Guard Ability.

moves.name: Steel Roller
moves.desc: Fails if there is no terrain active. Ends the effects of Electric Terrain, Grassy Terrain, Misty Terrain, and Psychic Terrain.

moves.name: Steel Wing
moves.desc: Has a 10% chance to raise the user's Defense by 1 stage.

moves.name: Sticky Web
moves.desc: Sets up a hazard on the opposing side of the field, lowering the Speed by 1 stage of each opposing Pokemon that switches in, unless it is a Flying-type Pokemon or has the Levitate Ability. Fails if the effect is already active on the opposing side. Can be removed from the opposing side if any opposing Pokemon uses Mortal Spin, Rapid Spin, or Defog successfully, or is hit by Defog.

moves.name: Stockpile
moves.desc: Raises the user's Defense and Special Defense by 1 stage. The user's Stockpile count increases by 1. Fails if the user's Stockpile count is 3. The user's Stockpile count is reset to 0 when it is no longer active.

moves.name: Stoked Sparksurfer
moves.desc: Has a 100% chance to paralyze the target.

moves.name: Stomp
moves.desc: Has a 30% chance to make the target flinch. Damage doubles and no accuracy check is done if the target has used Minimize while active.

moves.name: Stomping Tantrum
moves.desc: Power doubles if the user's last move on the previous turn, including moves called by other moves or those used through Instruct, Magic Coat, Snatch, or the Dancer or Magic Bounce Abilities, failed to do any of its normal effects, not including damage from an unsuccessful High Jump Kick, Jump Kick, or Mind Blown, or if the user was prevented from moving by any effect other than recharging or Sky Drop. A move that was blocked by Baneful Bunker, Detect, King's Shield, Protect, Spiky Shield, Crafty Shield, Mat Block, Quick Guard, or Wide Guard will not double this move's power, nor will Bounce or Fly ending early due to the effect of Gravity, Smack Down, or Thousand Arrows.

moves.name: Stone Axe
moves.desc: If this move is successful, it sets up a hazard on the opposing side of the field, damaging each opposing Pokemon that switches in. Foes lose 1/32, 1/16, 1/8, 1/4, or 1/2 of their maximum HP, rounded down, based on their weakness to the Rock type; 0.25x, 0.5x, neutral, 2x, or 4x, respectively. Can be removed from the opposing side if any opposing Pokemon uses Mortal Spin, Rapid Spin, or Defog successfully, or is hit by Defog.

moves.name: Stone Edge
moves.desc: Has a higher chance for a critical hit.

moves.name: Stored Power
moves.desc: Power is equal to 20+(X*20), where X is the user's total stat stage changes that are greater than 0.

moves.name: Storm Throw
moves.desc: This move is always a critical hit unless the target is under the effect of Lucky Chant or has the Battle Armor or Shell Armor Abilities.

moves.name: Strange Steam
moves.desc: Has a 20% chance to confuse the target.

moves.name: Strength
moves.desc: No additional effect.

moves.name: Strength Sap
moves.desc: Lowers the target's Attack by 1 stage. The user restores its HP equal to the target's Attack stat calculated with its stat stage before this move was used. If Big Root is held by the user, the HP recovered is 1.3x normal, rounded half down. Fails if the target's Attack stat stage is -6.

moves.name: String Shot
moves.desc: Lowers the target's Speed by 2 stages.

moves.name: Struggle
moves.desc: Deals typeless damage to a random opposing Pokemon. If this move was successful, the user loses 1/4 of its maximum HP, rounded half up, and the Rock Head Ability does not prevent this. This move is automatically used if none of the user's known moves can be selected.

moves.name: Struggle Bug
moves.desc: Has a 100% chance to lower the target's Special Attack by 1 stage.

moves.name: Stuff Cheeks
moves.desc: This move cannot be selected unless the user is holding a Berry. The user eats its Berry and raises its Defense by 2 stages. This effect is not prevented by the Klutz or Unnerve Abilities, or the effects of Embargo or Magic Room. Fails if the user is not holding a Berry.

moves.name: Stun Spore
moves.desc: Paralyzes the target.

moves.name: Submission
moves.desc: If the target lost HP, the user takes recoil damage equal to 1/4 the HP lost by the target, rounded half up, but not less than 1 HP.

moves.name: Substitute
moves.desc: The user takes 1/4 of its maximum HP, rounded down, and puts it into a substitute to take its place in battle. The substitute is removed once enough damage is inflicted on it, or if the user switches out or faints. Baton Pass can be used to transfer the substitute to an ally, and the substitute will keep its remaining HP. Until the substitute is broken, it receives damage from all attacks made by other Pokemon and shields the user from status effects and stat stage changes caused by other Pokemon. Sound-based moves and Pokemon with the Infiltrator Ability ignore substitutes. The user still takes normal damage from weather and status effects while behind its substitute. If the substitute breaks during a multi-hit attack, the user will take damage from any remaining hits. If a substitute is created while the user is trapped by a binding move, the binding effect ends immediately. Fails if the user does not have enough HP remaining to create a substitute without fainting, or if it already has a substitute.

moves.name: Subzero Slammer
moves.desc: Power is equal to the base move's Z-Power.

moves.name: Sucker Punch
moves.desc: Fails if the target did not select a physical attack, special attack, or Me First for use this turn, or if the target moves before the user.

moves.name: Sunny Day
moves.desc: For 5 turns, the weather becomes Sunny Day. The damage of Fire-type attacks is multiplied by 1.5 and the damage of Water-type attacks is multiplied by 0.5 during the effect. Lasts for 8 turns if the user is holding Heat Rock. Fails if the current weather is Sunny Day.

moves.name: Sunsteel Strike
moves.desc: This move and its effects ignore the Abilities of other Pokemon.

moves.name: Super Fang
moves.desc: Deals damage to the target equal to half of its current HP, rounded down, but not less than 1 HP.

moves.name: Superpower
moves.desc: Lowers the user's Attack and Defense by 1 stage.

moves.name: Supersonic
moves.desc: Causes the target to become confused.

moves.name: Supersonic Skystrike
moves.desc: Power is equal to the base move's Z-Power.

moves.name: Surf
moves.desc: Damage doubles if the target is using Dive.

moves.name: Surging Strikes
moves.desc: Hits three times. This move is always a critical hit unless the target is under the effect of Lucky Chant or has the Battle Armor or Shell Armor Abilities.

moves.name: Swagger
moves.desc: Raises the target's Attack by 2 stages and confuses it.

moves.name: Swallow
moves.desc: The user restores its HP based on its Stockpile count. Restores 1/4 of its maximum HP if it's 1, 1/2 of its maximum HP if it's 2, both rounded half down, and all of its HP if it's 3. Fails if the user's Stockpile count is 0. The user's Defense and Special Defense decrease by as many stages as Stockpile had increased them, and the user's Stockpile count resets to 0.

moves.name: Sweet Kiss
moves.desc: Causes the target to become confused.

moves.name: Sweet Scent
moves.desc: Lowers the target's evasiveness by 2 stages.

moves.name: Swift
moves.desc: This move does not check accuracy.

moves.name: Switcheroo
moves.desc: The user swaps its held item with the target's held item. Fails if either the user or the target is holding a Mail or Z-Crystal, if neither is holding an item, if the user is trying to give or take a Mega Stone to or from the species that can Mega Evolve with it, or if the user is trying to give or take a Blue Orb, a Red Orb, a Griseous Orb, a Plate, a Drive, or a Memory to or from a Kyogre, a Groudon, a Giratina, an Arceus, a Genesect, or a Silvally, respectively. The target is immune to this move if it has the Sticky Hold Ability.

moves.name: Swords Dance
moves.desc: Raises the user's Attack by 2 stages.

moves.name: Synchronoise
moves.desc: The target is immune if it does not share a type with the user.

moves.name: Synthesis
moves.desc: The user restores 1/2 of its maximum HP if Delta Stream or no weather conditions are in effect or if the user is holding Utility Umbrella, 2/3 of its maximum HP if the weather is Desolate Land or Sunny Day, and 1/4 of its maximum HP if the weather is Primordial Sea, Rain Dance, Sandstorm, or Snow, all rounded half down.

moves.name: Tackle
moves.desc: No additional effect.

moves.name: Tail Glow
moves.desc: Raises the user's Special Attack by 3 stages.

moves.name: Tail Slap
moves.desc: Hits two to five times. Has a 35% chance to hit two or three times and a 15% chance to hit four or five times. If one of the hits breaks the target's substitute, it will take damage for the remaining hits. If the user has the Skill Link Ability, this move will always hit five times.

moves.name: Tail Whip
moves.desc: Lowers the target's Defense by 1 stage.

moves.name: Tailwind
moves.desc: For 4 turns, the user and its party members have their Speed doubled. Fails if this move is already in effect for the user's side.

moves.name: Take Down
moves.desc: If the target lost HP, the user takes recoil damage equal to 1/4 the HP lost by the target, rounded half up, but not less than 1 HP.

moves.name: Take Heart
moves.desc: The user cures its non-volatile status condition. Raises the user's Special Attack and Special Defense by 1 stage.

moves.name: Tar Shot
moves.desc: Lowers the target's Speed by 1 stage. Until the target switches out, the effectiveness of Fire-type moves is doubled against it.

moves.name: Taunt
moves.desc: Prevents the target from using non-damaging moves for its next three turns. Pokemon with the Oblivious Ability or protected by the Aroma Veil Ability are immune.

moves.name: Tearful Look
moves.desc: Lowers the target's Attack and Special Attack by 1 stage.

moves.name: Teatime
moves.desc: All active Pokemon consume their held Berries. This effect is not prevented by substitutes, the Klutz or Unnerve Abilities, or the effects of Embargo or Magic Room. Fails if no active Pokemon is holding a Berry.

moves.name: Techno Blast
moves.desc: This move's type depends on the user's held Drive.

moves.name: Tectonic Rage
moves.desc: Power is equal to the base move's Z-Power.

moves.name: Teeter Dance
moves.desc: Causes the target to become confused.

moves.name: Telekinesis
moves.desc: For 3 turns, the target cannot avoid any attacks made against it, other than OHKO moves, as long as it remains active. During the effect, the target is immune to Ground-type attacks and the effects of Spikes, Toxic Spikes, Sticky Web, and the Arena Trap Ability as long as it remains active. If the target uses Baton Pass, the replacement will gain the effect. Ingrain, Smack Down, Thousand Arrows, and Iron Ball override this move if the target is under any of their effects. Fails if the target is already under this effect or the effects of Ingrain, Smack Down, or Thousand Arrows. The target is immune to this move on use if its species is Diglett, Dugtrio, Alolan Diglett, Alolan Dugtrio, Sandygast, Palossand, or Gengar while Mega-Evolved. Mega Gengar cannot be under this effect by any means.

moves.name: Teleport
moves.desc: If this move is successful and the user has not fainted, the user switches out even if it is trapped and is replaced immediately by a selected party member. The user does not switch out if there are no unfainted party members.

moves.name: Tera Blast
moves.desc: If the user is Terastallized, this move becomes a physical attack if the user's Attack is greater than its Special Attack, including stat stage changes, and this move's type becomes the same as the user's Tera Type.

moves.name: Terrain Pulse
moves.desc: Power doubles if the user is grounded and a terrain is active, and this move's type changes to match. Electric type during Electric Terrain, Grass type during Grassy Terrain, Fairy type during Misty Terrain, and Psychic type during Psychic Terrain.

moves.name: Thief
moves.desc: If this attack was successful and the user has not fainted, it steals the target's held item if the user is not holding one. The target's item is not stolen if it is a Mail or Z-Crystal, or if the target is a Kyogre holding a Blue Orb, a Groudon holding a Red Orb, a Giratina holding a Griseous Orb, an Arceus holding a Plate, a Genesect holding a Drive, a Silvally holding a Memory, or a Pokemon that can Mega Evolve holding the Mega Stone for its species. Items lost to this move cannot be regained with Recycle or the Harvest Ability.

moves.name: Thousand Arrows
moves.desc: This move can hit airborne Pokemon, which includes Flying-type Pokemon, Pokemon with the Levitate Ability, Pokemon holding an Air Balloon, and Pokemon under the effect of Magnet Rise or Telekinesis. If the target is a Flying type and is not already grounded, this move deals neutral damage regardless of its other type(s). This move can hit a target using Bounce, Fly, or Sky Drop. If this move hits a target under the effect of Bounce, Fly, Magnet Rise, or Telekinesis, the effect ends. If the target is a Flying type that has not used Roost this turn or a Pokemon with the Levitate Ability, it loses its immunity to Ground-type attacks and the Arena Trap Ability as long as it remains active. During the effect, Magnet Rise fails for the target and Telekinesis fails against the target.

moves.name: Thousand Waves
moves.desc: Prevents the target from switching out. The target can still switch out if it is holding Shed Shell or uses Baton Pass, Flip Turn, Parting Shot, Teleport, U-turn, or Volt Switch. If the target leaves the field using Baton Pass, the replacement will remain trapped. The effect ends if the user leaves the field.

moves.name: Thrash
moves.desc: The user spends two or three turns locked into this move and becomes confused immediately after its move on the last turn of the effect if it is not already. This move targets an opposing Pokemon at random on each turn. If the user is prevented from moving, is asleep at the beginning of a turn, or the attack is not successful against the target on the first turn of the effect or the second turn of a three-turn effect, the effect ends without causing confusion. If this move is called by Sleep Talk and the user is asleep, the move is used for one turn and does not confuse the user.

moves.name: Throat Chop
moves.desc: For 2 turns, the target cannot use sound-based moves.

moves.name: Thunder
moves.desc: Has a 30% chance to paralyze the target. This move can hit a target using Bounce, Fly, or Sky Drop, or is under the effect of Sky Drop. If the weather is Primordial Sea or Rain Dance, this move does not check accuracy. If the weather is Desolate Land or Sunny Day, this move's accuracy is 50%. If this move is used against a Pokemon holding Utility Umbrella, this move's accuracy remains at 70%.

moves.name: Thunderbolt
moves.desc: Has a 10% chance to paralyze the target.

moves.name: Thunder Cage
moves.desc: Prevents the target from switching for four or five turns (seven turns if the user is holding Grip Claw). Causes damage to the target equal to 1/8 of its maximum HP (1/6 if the user is holding Binding Band), rounded down, at the end of each turn during effect. The target can still switch out if it is holding Shed Shell or uses Baton Pass, Flip Turn, Parting Shot, Shed Tail, Teleport, U-turn, or Volt Switch. The effect ends if either the user or the target leaves the field, or if the target uses Mortal Spin, Rapid Spin, or Substitute successfully. This effect is not stackable or reset by using this or another binding move.

moves.name: Thunder Fang
moves.desc: Has a 10% chance to paralyze the target and a 10% chance to make it flinch.

moves.name: Thunderous Kick
moves.desc: Has a 100% chance to lower the target's Defense by 1 stage.

moves.name: Thunder Punch
moves.desc: Has a 10% chance to paralyze the target.

moves.name: Thunder Shock
moves.desc: Has a 10% chance to paralyze the target.

moves.name: Thunder Wave
moves.desc: Paralyzes the target. This move does not ignore type immunity.

moves.name: Tickle
moves.desc: Lowers the target's Attack and Defense by 1 stage.

moves.name: Tidy Up
moves.desc: Raises the user's Attack and Speed by 1 stage. Removes subtitutes from all active Pokemon and ends the effects of Spikes, Stealth Rock, Sticky Web, and Toxic Spikes for both sides.

moves.name: Topsy-Turvy
moves.desc: The target's positive stat stages become negative and vice versa. Fails if all of the target's stat stages are 0.

moves.name: Torch Song
moves.desc: Has a 100% chance to raise the user's Special Attack by 1 stage.

moves.name: Torment
moves.desc: Prevents the target from selecting the same move for use two turns in a row. This effect ends when the target is no longer active.

moves.name: Toxic
moves.desc: Badly poisons the target. If a Poison-type Pokemon uses this move, the target cannot avoid the attack, even if the target is in the middle of a two-turn move.

moves.name: Toxic Spikes
moves.desc: Sets up a hazard on the opposing side of the field, poisoning each opposing Pokemon that switches in, unless it is a Flying-type Pokemon or has the Levitate Ability. Can be used up to two times before failing. Opposing Pokemon become poisoned with one layer and badly poisoned with two layers. Can be removed from the opposing side if any opposing Pokemon uses Mortal Spin, Rapid Spin, or Defog successfully, is hit by Defog, or a grounded Poison-type Pokemon switches in. Safeguard prevents the opposing party from being poisoned on switch-in, but a substitute does not.

moves.name: Toxic Thread
moves.desc: Lowers the target's Speed by 1 stage and poisons it.

moves.name: Trailblaze
moves.desc: Has a 100% chance to raise the user's Speed by 1 stage.

moves.name: Transform
moves.desc: The user transforms into the target. The target's current stats, stat stages, types, moves, Ability, weight, gender, and sprite are copied. The user's level and HP remain the same and each copied move receives only 5 PP, with a maximum of 5 PP each. The user can no longer change formes if it would have the ability to do so. This move fails if it hits a substitute, if either the user or the target is already transformed, or if either is behind an Illusion.

moves.name: Tri Attack
moves.desc: Has a 20% chance to either burn, freeze, or paralyze the target.

moves.name: Trick
moves.desc: The user swaps its held item with the target's held item. Fails if either the user or the target is holding a Mail or Z-Crystal, if neither is holding an item, if the user is trying to give or take a Mega Stone to or from the species that can Mega Evolve with it, or if the user is trying to give or take a Blue Orb, a Red Orb, a Griseous Orb, a Plate, a Drive, or a Memory to or from a Kyogre, a Groudon, a Giratina, an Arceus, a Genesect, or a Silvally, respectively. The target is immune to this move if it has the Sticky Hold Ability.

moves.name: Trick-or-Treat
moves.desc: Causes the Ghost type to be added to the target, effectively making it have two or three types. Fails if the target is already a Ghost type. If Forest's Curse adds a type to the target, it replaces the type added by this move and vice versa.

moves.name: Trick Room
moves.desc: For 5 turns, the Speed of every Pokemon is recalculated for the purposes of determining turn order. During the effect, each Pokemon's Speed is considered to be (10000 - its normal Speed), and if this value is greater than 8191, 8192 is subtracted from it. If this move is used during the effect, the effect ends.

moves.name: Triple Arrows
moves.desc: Has a 50% chance to lower the target's Defense by 1 stage, a 30% chance to make it flinch, and a higher chance for a critical hit.

moves.name: Triple Axel
moves.desc: Hits three times. Power increases to 40 for the second hit and 60 for the third. This move checks accuracy for each hit, and the attack ends if the target avoids a hit. If one of the hits breaks the target's substitute, it will take damage for the remaining hits. If the user has the Skill Link Ability, this move will always hit three times.

moves.name: Triple Dive
moves.desc: Hits three times.

moves.name: Triple Kick
moves.desc: Hits three times. Power increases to 20 for the second hit and 30 for the third. This move checks accuracy for each hit, and the attack ends if the target avoids a hit. If one of the hits breaks the target's substitute, it will take damage for the remaining hits. If the user has the Skill Link Ability, this move will always hit three times.

moves.name: Trop Kick
moves.desc: Has a 100% chance to lower the target's Attack by 1 stage.

moves.name: Trump Card
moves.desc: The power of this move is based on the amount of PP remaining after normal PP reduction and the Pressure Ability resolve. 200 power for 0 PP, 80 power for 1 PP, 60 power for 2 PP, 50 power for 3 PP, and 40 power for 4 or more PP.

moves.name: Twin Beam
moves.desc: Hits twice. If the first hit breaks the target's substitute, it will take damage for the second hit.

moves.name: Twineedle
moves.desc: Hits twice, with each hit having a 20% chance to poison the target. If the first hit breaks the target's substitute, it will take damage for the second hit.

moves.name: Twinkle Tackle
moves.desc: Power is equal to the base move's Z-Power.

moves.name: Twister
moves.desc: Has a 20% chance to make the target flinch. Power doubles if the target is using Bounce, Fly, or Sky Drop, or is under the effect of Sky Drop.

moves.name: U-turn
moves.desc: If this move is successful and the user has not fainted, the user switches out even if it is trapped and is replaced immediately by a selected party member. The user does not switch out if there are no unfainted party members, or if the target switched out using an Eject Button or through the effect of the Emergency Exit or Wimp Out Abilities.

moves.name: Uproar
moves.desc: The user spends three turns locked into this move. This move targets an opponent at random on each turn. On the first of the three turns, all sleeping active Pokemon wake up. During the three turns, no active Pokemon can fall asleep by any means, and Pokemon switched in during the effect do not wake up. If the user is prevented from moving or the attack is not successful against the target during one of the turns, the effect ends.

moves.name: Vacuum Wave
moves.desc: No additional effect.

moves.name: V-create
moves.desc: Lowers the user's Speed, Defense, and Special Defense by 1 stage.

moves.name: Veevee Volley
moves.desc: Power is equal to the greater of (user's Happiness * 2/5), rounded down, or 1.

moves.name: Venom Drench
moves.desc: Lowers the target's Attack, Special Attack, and Speed by 1 stage if the target is poisoned. Fails if the target is not poisoned.

moves.name: Venoshock
moves.desc: Power doubles if the target is poisoned.

moves.name: Victory Dance
moves.desc: Raises the user's Attack, Defense, and Speed by 1 stage.

moves.name: Vine Whip
moves.desc: No additional effect.

moves.name: Vise Grip
moves.desc: No additional effect.

moves.name: Vital Throw
moves.desc: This move does not check accuracy.

moves.name: Volt Switch
moves.desc: If this move is successful and the user has not fainted, the user switches out even if it is trapped and is replaced immediately by a selected party member. The user does not switch out if there are no unfainted party members, or if the target switched out using an Eject Button or through the effect of the Emergency Exit or Wimp Out Abilities.

moves.name: Volt Tackle
moves.desc: Has a 10% chance to paralyze the target. If the target lost HP, the user takes recoil damage equal to 33% the HP lost by the target, rounded half up, but not less than 1 HP.

moves.name: Wake-Up Slap
moves.desc: Power doubles if the target is asleep. If the user has not fainted, the target wakes up.

moves.name: Waterfall
moves.desc: Has a 20% chance to make the target flinch.

moves.name: Water Gun
moves.desc: No additional effect.

moves.name: Water Pledge
moves.desc: If one of the user's allies chose to use Fire Pledge or Grass Pledge this turn and has not moved yet, it takes its turn immediately after the user and the user's move does nothing. If combined with Fire Pledge, the ally uses Water Pledge with 150 power and a rainbow appears on the user's side for 4 turns, which doubles secondary effect chances and stacks with the Serene Grace Ability, except effects that cause flinching can only have their chance doubled once. If combined with Grass Pledge, the ally uses Grass Pledge with 150 power and a swamp appears on the target's side for 4 turns, which quarters the Speed of each Pokemon on that side. When used as a combined move, this move gains STAB no matter what the user's type is. This move does not consume the user's Water Gem, and cannot be redirected by the Storm Drain Ability.

moves.name: Water Pulse
moves.desc: Has a 20% chance to confuse the target.

moves.name: Water Shuriken
moves.desc: Hits two to five times. Has a 35% chance to hit two or three times and a 15% chance to hit four or five times. If one of the hits breaks the target's substitute, it will take damage for the remaining hits. If the user has the Skill Link Ability, this move will always hit five times. If the user is an Ash-Greninja with the Battle Bond Ability, this move has a power of 20 and always hits three times.

moves.name: Water Sport
moves.desc: For 5 turns, all Fire-type attacks used by any active Pokemon have their power multiplied by 0.33. Fails if this effect is already active.

moves.name: Water Spout
moves.desc: Power is equal to (user's current HP * 150 / user's maximum HP), rounded down, but not less than 1.

moves.name: Wave Crash
moves.desc: If the target lost HP, the user takes recoil damage equal to 33% the HP lost by the target, rounded half up, but not less than 1 HP.

moves.name: Weather Ball
moves.desc: Power doubles if a weather condition other than Delta Stream is active, and this move's type changes to match. Ice type during Snow, Water type during Primordial Sea or Rain Dance, Rock type during Sandstorm, and Fire type during Desolate Land or Sunny Day. If the user is holding Utility Umbrella and uses Weather Ball during Primordial Sea, Rain Dance, Desolate Land, or Sunny Day, this move remains Normal type and does not double in power.

moves.name: Whirlpool
moves.desc: Prevents the target from switching for four or five turns (seven turns if the user is holding Grip Claw). Causes damage to the target equal to 1/8 of its maximum HP (1/6 if the user is holding Binding Band), rounded down, at the end of each turn during effect. The target can still switch out if it is holding Shed Shell or uses Baton Pass, Flip Turn, Parting Shot, Shed Tail, Teleport, U-turn, or Volt Switch. The effect ends if either the user or the target leaves the field, or if the target uses Mortal Spin, Rapid Spin, or Substitute successfully. This effect is not stackable or reset by using this or another binding move.

moves.name: Whirlwind
moves.desc: The target is forced to switch out and be replaced with a random unfainted ally. Fails if the target is the last unfainted Pokemon in its party, or if the target used Ingrain previously or has the Suction Cups Ability.

moves.name: Wicked Blow
moves.desc: This move is always a critical hit unless the target is under the effect of Lucky Chant or has the Battle Armor or Shell Armor Abilities.

moves.name: Wicked Torque
moves.desc: Has a 10% chance to cause the target to fall asleep.

moves.name: Wide Guard
moves.desc: The user and its party members are protected from moves made by other Pokemon, including allies, during this turn that target all adjacent foes or all adjacent Pokemon. This move modifies the same 1/X chance of being successful used by other protection moves, where X starts at 1 and triples each time this move is successfully used, but does not use the chance to check for failure. X resets to 1 if this move fails, if the user's last move used is not Baneful Bunker, Detect, Endure, King's Shield, Max Guard, Obstruct, Protect, Quick Guard, Silk Trap, Spiky Shield, or Wide Guard, or if it was one of those moves and the user's protection was broken. Fails if the user moves last this turn or if this move is already in effect for the user's side.

moves.name: Wildbolt Storm
moves.desc: Has a 20% chance to paralyze the target.

moves.name: Wild Charge
moves.desc: If the target lost HP, the user takes recoil damage equal to 1/4 the HP lost by the target, rounded half up, but not less than 1 HP.

moves.name: Will-O-Wisp
moves.desc: Burns the target.

moves.name: Wing Attack
moves.desc: No additional effect.

moves.name: Wish
moves.desc: At the end of the next turn, the Pokemon at the user's position has 1/2 of the user's maximum HP restored to it, rounded down. Fails if this move is already in effect for the user's position.

moves.name: Withdraw
moves.desc: Raises the user's Defense by 1 stage.

moves.name: Wonder Room
moves.desc: For 5 turns, all active Pokemon have their Defense and Special Defense stats swapped. Stat stage changes are unaffected. If this move is used during the effect, the effect ends.

moves.name: Wood Hammer
moves.desc: If the target lost HP, the user takes recoil damage equal to 33% the HP lost by the target, rounded half up, but not less than 1 HP.

moves.name: Work Up
moves.desc: Raises the user's Attack and Special Attack by 1 stage.

moves.name: Worry Seed
moves.desc: Causes the target's Ability to become Insomnia. Fails if the target's Ability is As One, Battle Bond, Comatose, Commander, Disguise, Gulp Missile, Hadron Engine, Ice Face, Insomnia, Multitype, Orichalcum Pulse, Power Construct, Protosynthesis, Quark Drive, RKS System, Schooling, Shields Down, Stance Change, Truant, Zen Mode, or Zero to Hero.

moves.name: Wrap
moves.desc: Prevents the target from switching for four or five turns (seven turns if the user is holding Grip Claw). Causes damage to the target equal to 1/8 of its maximum HP (1/6 if the user is holding Binding Band), rounded down, at the end of each turn during effect. The target can still switch out if it is holding Shed Shell or uses Baton Pass, Flip Turn, Parting Shot, Shed Tail, Teleport, U-turn, or Volt Switch. The effect ends if either the user or the target leaves the field, or if the target uses Mortal Spin, Rapid Spin, or Substitute successfully. This effect is not stackable or reset by using this or another binding move.

moves.name: Wring Out
moves.desc: Power is equal to 120 * (target's current HP / target's maximum HP), rounded half down, but not less than 1.

moves.name: X-Scissor
moves.desc: No additional effect.

moves.name: Yawn
moves.desc: Causes the target to fall asleep at the end of the next turn. Fails when used if the target cannot fall asleep or if it already has a non-volatile status condition. At the end of the next turn, if the target is still active, does not have a non-volatile status condition, and can fall asleep, it falls asleep. If the target becomes affected, this effect cannot be prevented by Safeguard or a substitute, or by falling asleep and waking up during the effect.

moves.name: Zap Cannon
moves.desc: Has a 100% chance to paralyze the target.

moves.name: Zen Headbutt
moves.desc: Has a 20% chance to make the target flinch.

moves.name: Zing Zap
moves.desc: Has a 30% chance to make the target flinch.

moves.name: Zippy Zap
moves.desc: Has a 100% chance to raise the user's evasion by 1 stage.
